CatDescriptText: Mr. Frank Brody, parking lot attendant, 1231 Berkshire Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 14, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the Federal Government should provide financial aid for students of exceptional ability to further their education when the students are unable to do so for themselves?" answer reads: "The government does already. If the youth are up against it, they can borrow from the government."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Frank Brody wearing dark zippered jacket with two woven leather buttons on collar, posed in front of brick wall
